stomatadetector package¶

Submodules¶

stomatadetector.filebrowser module¶

Module for implementing a rudimentary file chooser and file selection methods in Jupyter Notebooks

class stomatadetector.filebrowser.FileBrowser¶

Bases: object

Implements an ipywidgets directory chooser. Only shows directories.

>>> f = FileBrowser
>>> f.widget() # activate the widget
>>> ...
>>> f.path # get the selected directory...
widget()¶
stomatadetector.filebrowser.GetFlexList(path)¶

Returns a list of files ending in *.flex in provided folder

Param:path
Returns:list – filenames

stomatadetector.flexmetadata module¶

Module for dealing with Multi-TIFF metadata in Perkin ELmer .flex files.

class stomatadetector.flexmetadata.FlexMetaData(flex_filepath)¶

Bases: object

Implements an xmltodict object that contains .flex metadata

Param:filename
Returns:xmltodict object - nested structure with data 
>>> flex_file = '/Users/user/test/002002002/002002002.flex'
>>> a = parse_flex_metadata(flex_file)
>>> metadata = a[0]
>>> print(metadata['Root']['Arrays']['Array'][0])
>>>
>>> OrderedDict([('@Type', 'Image'), ('@Name', 'Exp1Cam2'), ('@Width', '688'), ('@Height', '512'), ('@BitsPerPixel', '16'), ('@CompressionType', ''), ('@CompressionRate', ''), ('@Factor', '1.000000')])

stomatadetector.stomataobjects module¶

Module for segmenting stomata sub-images and related measurements from a .flex file

class stomatadetector.stomataobjects.GetStomataObjects(flex_file_name_list, options)¶

Bases: object

Gets list of LeafImage objects from a list of flex file names. Each file name provided returns a different LeafImage object. Each LeafImage object has an attribute stomata_objects that contains stomata information

>>> analysed_flex_files = sd.GetStomataObjects(flex_file_names, options)
extract_stomata()¶
class stomatadetector.stomataobjects.LeafImage(flex_file)¶

Bases: object

represents the leaf image and the objects found in it from a single flex file

Variables:
  • flex_file – the flex file represented
  • mp – the maximum projection of the flex file
  • stomata_positions – the python Slice objects describing the sub images of the maximum projection containing detected stomata
  • binary_obj_img – a binary image of the objects
  • stomata_labels – a numpy label image of the stomata found
  • stomata_objects – list of StomataObject’s - one per detected stomate
class stomatadetector.stomataobjects.StomataObject(max_proj_img_slice, stomata_pos, stomata_props, binary_obj_img)¶

Bases: object

represents a single object, presumed to be a stomate from the segmented flex file

Variables:
  • detected_stomate – binary image of stomate
  • intensity_image – normal image of stomate
  • props – properties of stomata - calculated by skimage.measure.regionprops in original mp image
  • position_in_image – Python slice object describing the position in the original image
  • pore_binary_image – binary image of pore region
  • pore_props – properties of pore region - calculated by skimage.measure.regionprops - only first property list is returned if multiple objects are found.
stomatadetector.stomataobjects.get_pore(img, margin=10)¶

Extracts darkest region from subimage - in context presumed to be the pore. Inverts the image and finds the brightest region. returns binary image in which pixels with value 1 are within margin percent of the image max. All other pixel values are 0.

Parameters:
  • img (numpy.ndarray) – input image section
  • margin (int) – the percent of the inverted image maximum pixel value to take as the minimum pixel value for the pore
Returns:

binary numpy.ndaarray
stomatadetector.stomataobjects.get_stomata(max_proj_image, rescale_min=50, rescale_max=100, min_obj_size=100, max_obj_size=1000)¶

Performs image segmentation from a max_proj_image. Rescales the intensity of the image to between rescale_min and rescale_max. Disposes of objects in range min_obj_size to max_obj_size

Parameters:
  • max_proj_image (numpy.ndarray, uint16) – the maximum projection image
  • rescale_min (int) – minimum pixel intensity that values in image will be rescaled to
  • rescale_max (int) – maximum pixel intensity that values in image will be rescaled to
  • min_obj_size (int) – minimum size of object to keep
  • max_obj_size (int) – maximum size of object to keep
Returns:

list of [ [coordinates of kept objects - list of slice objects],

binary object image - numpy.ndarray, labelled object image - numpy.ndarray

]
stomatadetector.stomataobjects.get_stomata_info(stomata)¶
stomatadetector.stomataobjects.imshow(image, title='No Title', cmap='hot', width=36, height=36, **kwargs)¶

render image as a graphic

Parameters:image (numpy.ndarray) – image to show
stomatadetector.stomataobjects.max_proj(img_list)¶

maximum projection from a list of numpy ndarrays

Parameters:img_list (list) – list of numpy ndarrays to merge
Returns:ndarray – the maximum projection of the list
stomatadetector.stomataobjects.maximum_project_flex(flex_file)¶

maximum projection and rescaling of a flex_file for skimage.

Parameters:flex_file – the flex file to maximum project and rescale
Returns:numpy.ndarray maximum projection of all planes in the Flex file into one plane in ‘uint16’ type.
stomatadetector.stomataobjects.rescale(img)¶

sets input image to type ‘uint16’

Parameters:img – image :type img: numpy.ndarray
Returns:numpy.ndarray – with type ‘unint16’
